author: Filip Timotija
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) is pressuring Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to resign after this week’s tumult at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that saw top officials depart after the agency director was ousted.  Sanders, the ranking member on the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions (HELP)…
title: Sanders pressures RFK Jr. to resign as Health chief after CDC chaos

author: Les Rubin, opinion contributor
description: Social Security is broken and needs to be fixed with a transition plan to private accounts, which would provide higher retirement income, promote economic growth, and eliminate the government's massive unfunded liability.
title: Private Social Security accounts offer a path to reform

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: National Political Correspondent Maggie Haberman said the latest appeals court ruling on President Trump’s sweeping tariffs represents a “big blow” to the Trump administration’s agenda. “This is the one that a lot of people who follow trade issues have been concerned about and is the outcome that they anticipated, frankly,” Haberman told CNN’s Jake Tapper…
title: Haberman calls tariff ruling a ‘big blow’ to Trump agenda

author: Ella Lee
description: President Trump has found a new weapon of choice in his retribution campaign against his foes: mortgage fraud claims.   At least three prominent Trump adversaries have been targeted with Justice Department probes into their personal real estate dealings.   The president most recently pointed to allegations against Federal Reserve board of governors member Lisa Cook to…
title: Mortgage fraud claims become ammunition against Trump’s foes

author: Nick Jachim
description: Finding a home for the right price is never easy, no matter where you live in the U.S. However, a new report from Zillow shows that some major markets are having significantly more luck finding affordable homes than others.
title: Residents in these cities are seeing more affordable homes hit the market

author: The Associated Press
description: Budget carrier Spirit Airlines said Friday that it has filed for fresh bankruptcy protection months after emerging from a Chapter 11 reorganization.
title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection again

author: Casey Eilbert, opinion contributor
description: Critics are right to be alarmed that the replacement of nonpartisan experts with political loyalists threatens democratic government, but they’re wrong to think it’s a problem that starts and ends with Donald Trump.
title: Don’t blame Trump — civil service politicization has been going on for decades

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: In recent years, consumers across the country have increasingly encountered digital payment screens at coffee shops, retail outlets or quick-service restaurants.
title: How much do Americans ‘guilt-tip’ every year?

author: Jonathan Turley, opinion contributor
description: As a company, OpenAI often shows little more empathy than its AI creations.
title: OpenAI’s dark side: ChatGPT accused of causing suicide, murder

author: Anna Kutz
description: The funds would be administered through the Federal Emergency Management Agency's existing nonprofit security grant program.
title: DHS to offer $110M to faith-based organizations for security upgrades after Minnesota shooting

author: Filip Timotija
description: Russia launched another “massive” aerial attack overnight Saturday, hitting Ukraine in an assault that killed at least one and wounded dozens of others.  The latest drone and missile attack struck the southern and central regions of war-torn Ukraine. In Zaporizhzhia, one woman was killed and 28 other people were injured, according to local officials.  The…
title: Russia hits southern Ukraine with ‘massive’ aerial strikes overnight, killing at least 1

author: Sarah Moriarty, opinion contributor
description: The Taliban, taking a cue from the Iranian regime, continually takes Americans whenever the opportunity arises for them, knowing how valuable a U.S. citizen has become as political leverage.
title: All American hostages held abroad must be released immediately

author: Teddy Grant
description: Brooke Hogan said she saw incision scars on her dad’s body, which confirmed for her that an autopsy was performed.
title: Brooke Hogan gets closure after viewing father Hulk Hogan’s body

author: Filip Timotija
description: Rep. Robert Garcia (D-Calif.), the top Democrat on the House Oversight Committee, said Friday that the estate of disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein will hand over the infamous “birthday book” and other documents early next month.  “The estate is actually going to actually now get us that book and a bunch of other documents that they…
title: House Dem says Epstein estate will hand over ‘birthday book,’ docs to lawmakers

author: Christopher Dols, opinion contributor
description: The implementation of privately developed artificial intelligence within government represents a modern-day digital Trojan horse.
title: Dangerous AI: Grok and Google shouldn’t be making military decisions

author: Marc Siegel, opinion contributor
description: The draconian measures reportedly being used in China fanned the flames of fear and brought back bad memories of COVID lockdowns and restrictions
title: China’s fearmongering could spread worse than its latest virus

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: "Victims often suffer the loss of entire banking, savings, retirement, or investment accounts under the guise of 'protecting' their assets," the FBI said in a news release.
title: FBI, cybersecurity experts warns of 3-phase scam that is draining bank accounts

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: A federal judge on Friday temporarily barred the Trump administration from expediting deportations amid President Trump’s crackdown on illegal immigration. U.S. District Judge Jia Cobb ruled that the administration’s moves to speed up the removal of undocumented migrants without appearing before a judge stood in the way of individual due process rights. “In defending this…
title: Judge throws wrench in Trump administration’s bid to speed up deportations

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Both major political parties are considering holding large-scale gatherings ahead of the midterm elections, underscoring the stakes next year as President Trump faces a potential check on his power if Democrats flip one or both chambers of Congress.  A Democratic National Committee (DNC) spokesperson confirmed that the party is considering an event next year “to…
title: Democrats, Republicans mull over potential conventions ahead of 2026 midterms

author: Aris Folley
description: President Trump’s new effort to cancel funding previously approved by Congress through “pocket rescissions” is setting up a political land mine for Congress as it races to avert a government shutdown by Sept. 30. The so-called pocket rescission comes as Democrats had warned that efforts by the administration to unilaterally claw back money would seriously…
title: Trump tosses grenade into GOP-Dem shutdown battle with pocket rescissions

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Dr. Demetre Daskalakis, the former head of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), on Thursday said Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has not been briefed by agency experts on measles, COVID-19 and the flu. “No one from my center…
title: RFK Jr. has never been briefed by CDC experts on measles, COVID-19 or flu, former official says

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former FBI Director Robert Mueller will reportedly no longer appear before the House Oversight Committee due to health issues after House Oversight Chair James Comer (R-Ky.) requested his presence to provide testimony on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s criminal activity, according to a recent report. “The committee intends to withdraw its subpoena,” a source told…
title: Mueller won’t testify in House Epstein probe due to health issues: Report
